text: Article submitted. Happy holidays everyone!
Thanks and merry Xmas
Nate’s latest is live. <http://articles.edhrec.com/commander-unfocus-grusilda-monster-masher/>
For the record, I just realized <@U3MTAQBE1> has a Lego figure for his bio picture and I think I love it.
Already one comment for <@U3MTAQBE1>’s where the reader jumped for joy.
I agree that Myriad with Grusilda is inspired.
I tried it in my Grusilda build and found it to be lackluster
But it’s a fun idea for sure
<@U3MTAQBE1>, when a mashed up creature dies, does it remain the same creature?
nope, they split
once they become cards again
Where is that ruling?
pretty sure it is in the faq
Not in the faq
huh
If you’re asking for the purposes of persist or undying, they’ll come back as one. Maro mentioned it on Twitter. I have a link in my Grusilda article
If it’s undying and one half is yours and the other half is an opponent’s, however, it has to go to the “owner’s” control, so you arm wrestle for custody
I'm asking which graveyard the creature goes to
You have to imply a bit. MaRo “ruled” on persist/undying but gy vs exile is one is a shared zone while the other isn’t.
Ugh. That arm wrestle thing is so stupid.
Arm wrestle?
Yeah, it comes up for a few things
If it dies they split into their separate things. It doesn’t need an Un-ruling in the faq, that’s just the normal rules
for things like meld
Joey, oh good
Well. Sorta, @joey. The fact that persist/undying works twinges things.
I would personally argue that who ever owns the creature that contributes the undying/persist is the one who gets the mashed creature

So does blinking a host-augment creature. That shouldn’t happen. Per meld rules, they’d separate. But it’s unstable. Silver borders don’t have ironclad rules because Maro is the only judge in the entire format. And as we saw in the game knights episode, he forgets things
When in doubt, go with the “spirit” of the game. Even though that sounds dangerously close to “heart of the cards” it’s really Maro’s  biggest metric for Un-rulings
He can’t be bothered with details.
He’s more of a “Big Squirrel” kinda guy.

He makes the game play the way he wants it to play. It’s like Bestow. If the creature you’re about to Bestow dies, your Bestow enchantment becomes a creature instead of fizzling. It doesn’t exactly make sense in the technical rules, they just paper over it to make it intuitive and fun. Unstable does a lot of that
I mean they could handle bestow like regenerate as a replacement effect so the rules can pretty readily handle that situation.
Is that why Bestow rates so poorly on the Storm Scale?
Well. It’s pretty mana intensive typically.
And the effect isn’t that fantastic.
Yeah, I suppose. Still disappointing

overall top ten for 2017, scaled to number of decks seen since that card is released:

1. Path of Ancestry, 10%
2. Vanquisher’s Banner, 7.6%
3. Unclaimed Territory, 6.9%
4. Disallow, 6.8%
5. Paradox Engine, 6.3%
6. Growing Rites of Itlimoc, 6%
7. Rishkar’s Expertise, 5.4%
8. Lifecrafter’s Bestiary, 4.5%
9. Primal Amulet, 4.4%
10. Anointed Procession, 4.4%
i’m not necessarily happy with the amount of bias present here
like ixilan cards are higher in general, AKH and hou both are low. AER was pre tappedout cutoff…
Awesome data! Not surprised to see the top 3 are all paired together.
Glad my intuition was on point, it felt like ixilan would be more edhable then some of the others
well you should be careful. i could stipulate that ixilan cards are higher in general because they haven’t been diluted by a newer set yet, like the others have
though AER is opposite of that, being the oldest with the strongest cards
i guess what im saying is the numbers are valid to compare inside of each, but crossing between sets i’m a bit worried
i loved akh and hour because of the lore...but honestly aside from scarab and loc god, I was meh about adding much into EDH besides solum
with ixilan though, there were a few gems for me, although I'm bias, because I had an AMAZING prerelease

You also have to consider context. Tribal Commander 2017 into a very tribal Ixalan. The majority of decks that are going to be submitted after a sets release are the new commanders. That’s going to skew numbers towards tribal since those decks need a high density of tribal-specific cards, like the top 3 are.
I agree with <@U3FV90TCZ>
When making my prelim list of top ten for the year Amonkhet proper had by far the least contenders
Hour at least gave big mana red burn a new commander to play with
I love as foretold and throne of the god Pharoah. I use harvest season in trostani and it wails, but I recognize that's niche.
Hour of promise and mirage mirror were both out of hour too
Amonkhet proper gave support to cycling decks
Yep and both are pretty sweet. More cycling is always fun.
Makes me miss the glory days of astral slide back in onslaught standard.
Astral slide decks are miserable to play against.
Those are decent cards but they just weren’t in the class as the Rishkar Expertise-level stuff
As Fortold and Throne are indeed good though
